title: Ticket #2839: Fix copying of scaling factors in classad literals
description:
ClassAds allow literal numerical values in expressions to have a trailing scaling factor letter (K for kilobytes, M for megabytes, etc). When the expression is evaluated, the literal value is scaled by the appropriate amount (using 1024 as the factor, not 1000).

When a classad::Literal object was copied, the factor (if any) was not copied properly. The destination object would have no scaling factor.
